Colin Powell , a retired Army general, said he won't decide whom to vote for until he sees all the candidates. Right now I do not see on the Republican side any one individual who I think is going to emerge at the top of the pile, he said, adding he thinks Barack Obama "is doing a good job right now." supportive" man. The X Factor host continued to dispel myths about the music mogul's character, having previously described the 51-year-old as "down-to-earth". Dermot O'Leary explained to the Daily Mail: He's a very interesting man, Simon Cowell . He's incredibly supportive as a boss and he shows a lot of compassion, but he hates indecision and he hates fear. "What he loves is confidence without arrogance, which is the holy grail. I've learnt a lot from him, and I owe him a great deal. Following are analysts' comments on his decision and its implications for Prime Minister David Cameron : LABOUR PARTY LEADER ED MILIBAND Labour has been saying for some months that there are real questions about Andy Coulson 's ability to do his job given the cloud of allegations hanging over him. We think he should have gone earlier. He has now done the right thing. I think there are questions about David Cameron 's judgement, about hanging on to him as long as he did.
